8970/A0/06/881/001.indicator_name: Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms
8970/A0/06/881/001.headline: The justice and child protection system professionals have increased their capacities to refer and implement diversionary schemes and alternative sanctions  implement newly defined protection procedures for child victims/witnesses in criminal justice proceedings and secure the best interests of the child are fully taken into account in civil proceedings.

8970/A0/06/881/001.indicator_name: Availability of Operational guidelines for protection of child victim/witness from secondary victimization

8970/A0/06/884/003.indicator_name: # of children including adolescents participating in structured education activities.
8970/A0/06/884/003.headline: Education system is strengthened for DRR and emergency response through development of framework for the response of education in emergency and capacity building of education institutions to include migrants and asylum seekers as well as partner organizations present working on non-formal education in the field.

8970/A0/06/884/001.indicator_name: Availability of knowledge management package (including costing) of diversified programme and half-day programmes
8970/A0/06/884/001.headline: Increased access to quality inclusive pre-school education of vulnerable children was achieved though development and modelling of diversified pre-schools programmes  policy and practice analyses and capacity building of local authorities and pre-school education professionals

8970/A0/06/882/001.status_value: Guidelines for foster care as shared parenting and kinship care finalized
8970/A0/06/882/001.indicator_name: Improvement of regulations related to foster care as shared parenting and kinship care
8970/A0/06/882/001.headline: Progress has been made in developing services for families living in multiple deprivation and for families with children with disabilities that are at risk of separation. Consensus has been reached by key actors on the need to ensure that they are fully part of the national child protection system.

8970/A0/06/882/003.status_value: 38 513 (17 909 girls 20 604 boys  incl. 147 children with disability)
8970/A0/06/882/003.indicator_name: UNICEF-targeted children in humanitarian situations benefitting from psychosocial support
8970/A0/06/882/003.headline: The child protection system has strengthened its capacities to protect refugee/migrant children with a particular focus on UASC. UNICEF has continued to provide psycho-social support through CFS  NFIs and playing a lead coordination role of key CP actors in the country.

8970/A0/06/882/003.indicator_name: Number of at-risk children (incl. UASC) identified through screening by outreach teams and child protection support centres
8970/A0/06/882/003.headline: The child protection system has strengthened its capacities to protect refugee/migrant children with a particular focus on UASC. UNICEF has continued to provide psycho-social support through CFS  NFIs and playing a lead coordination role of key CP actors in the country.

8970/A0/06/882/002.status_value: Mapping completed. Out of 145 municipalities in Serbia  total of 124 responded. 9 municipalities have VAC protocols  while 112  have domestic violence protocols that include VAC.
8970/A0/06/882/002.indicator_name: "Municipalities that implement local protocols for the protection of children from violence  abuse and neglect "
8970/A0/06/882/002.headline: Progress has been made in strengthening the capacities to identify and respond to online abuse. Knowledge generated on drivers of VAC to inform development of new national VAC strategy. Support to strengthen sectoral capacities and expand the work of VAC local inter-sectoral teams has been initiated in 12 municipalities.

8970/A0/05/002/004.status_value: 9 recommendations related to discrimination against children in 2014 equaling 19% (9 of 48). 8 opinions related to discrimination against children equaling 27% (8 of 30)
8970/A0/05/002/004.indicator_name: Share of recommendations related to children based on citizens' complaints submitted to the Commissioner

8970/A0/05/002/004.status_value: 1 general report issued for 2104 and submitted to the Parliament. Out of 91 recommendation for children  83.72% are implemented. Ombudsman released 4 special reports related to children (asylum seekers  children in detention and victims of sexual violence  women victims of violence)

8970/A0/05/002/004.status_value: 5 recommendations related to discrimination against children in 2012 equaling 19% (5 of 27).  The data relate to number of issued recommendations as the Implementation rate is not available. The indicator will be revised within the MTR process.
8970/A0/05/002/004.indicator_name: % of recommendations related to discrimination against children by legal entities implemented (either after initial recommendation submitted or after warning submitted)

8970/A0/06/883/003.indicator_name: (DEACTIVATED Jan 1 2017) UNICEF-targeted caregivers of children aged 0-23 months in humanitarian situations who are accessing infant and young child feeding counselling that includes early child hood stimulation and development services

8970/A0/06/885/001.indicator_name: % of general population who know of  the new TV content rating system
8970/A0/06/885/001.headline: Communication/dissemination plans were developed for awareness raising  social mobilisation and advocacy activities related to social inclusion of children  two communication initiatives on the prevention of digital violence were successfully implemented  while a media campaign resulted in increased awareness of parents about a new TV content rating system.
